segments.text: I notice the woman’s foot submerged in the puddle, yet she remains unaffected.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost infuriating how she's so focused on drying dishes that she’s blind to the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water could damage the cabinets or worse, cause someone to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shaking her, urging her to look down and see the mess she’s causing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But instead, she continues polishing the plate, as if nothing is amiss.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but think about how adults can sometimes be so tunnel-visioned in their tasks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's both frustrating and sad to see her so unaware of the impending disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
